| HistoryText             = 
[[Alexander Summers (Earth-616)|Havok]] was kidnapped and brainwashed by [[Henry McCoy (Earth-295)|Dark Beast]], forcing him to participate in the [[Dark Descendants (Earth-616)|Dark Descendants]] on the side of Onslaught.{{r|X-Factor #125|126}} 

After shaking off his conditioning, Havok decided to own his new villainous image, creating the impression that he had abandoned Xavier's dream and formed the Brotherhood as a proactive mutant team against humanity, abandoning the "evil mutants" tag. With the telepathic [[Ever (Earth-616)|Ever]], Havok faked an assassination attempt on [[Daily Bugle]] publisher [[John Jonah Jameson (Earth-616)|J. Jonah Jameson]] which was stopped by the [[X-Men (Earth-616)|X-Men]].{{r|Uncanny X-Men #339}}

Havok then recruited the [[Henry McCoy (Earth-295)|Dark Beast]] and his assassin [[Fatale (Earth-616)|Fatale]] into the Brotherhood in order to keep closer watch on the Dark Beast's activities.{{r|X-Factor #131}}

He briefly hosted [[Nathaniel Grey (Earth-295)|Nate Grey]] as a member, but the association didn't pan out.{{r|X-Man #26|29}}

After Havok's true motives were revealed and the Dark Beast was defeated, Havok disbanded the Brotherhood.{{r|X-Factor #143|144}}
